Adapted to Lower and Grammar Sehool Work. By G. A. HILL‚ Harvard University.

The principles which underlie the method employed in this work are the following :—

1. Geometrical instruction for beginners should proceed from the concrete to the abstract.

2. It should aim to develop the geometric imagination and the inventive faculty, by making reasonable demands upon the mental

powers of the learner. 3. 1t should be practical, —that is to say, it should seize every fitting opportunity to illustrate and explain the uses of Geometry.
